dmca.title: [ABUSE] Copyright infringement complaint
dmca.body:
EN


-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, October 27, 2004 1:18 PM
To: legal-response@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Copyright infringement complaint

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1


Forwarding to Legal for review.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/aup/


This is a forwarded message
From: Ken Aspeslagh <ken@ecamm.com>
To: abuse@theplanet.com
Date: Wednesday, October 27, 2004, 11:30:51 AM
Subject: [ABUSE] Copyright infringement complaint

===8<==============Original message text===============
Abuse Department:

It has been brought to our attention that copyrighted materials owned
by the company "Ecamm Network, LLC" are
being distributed by a "torrent" software website running from your
server(s).

The software server has been identified by our IT department as running
from your IP range.

The following host is providing illegal copies of our copyrighted
software "iGlasses v1.0.1" and "iChatUSBCam v2.0.2":

67.19.70.254

This is within the IP Range:
67.18.0.0 - 67.19.255.255
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.

The file is being distributed via bittorrent website.

Please see that this is taken care of at once. We will take all
necessary steps to enforce our copyrights.

Below is the necessary information to enable your DMCA agent to act on
this case:

1. A physical or electronic signature of a person authorized to act on
behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

Ken Aspeslagh (Officer) 10/27/04

If this is not sufficient, then let me know a fax number where I should
fax the signature.

2. Identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been
infringed,
or, if multiple copyrighted works at a single online site are covered
by a
single notification, a representative list of such works at that site.

The copyrighted work is entitled "iGlasses v1.0.1" and "iChatUSBCam
v2.0.2".
These are software products created by Ecamm Network, LLC.

3. Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or
to be
the subject of infringing activity and that is to be removed or access
to
which is to be disabled, and information reasonably sufficient to permit
location of the material.

The web host 67.19.70.254 is distributing the file via "bit torrent
servers".

4. Information reasonably sufficient to permit party to contact the
complaining party, such as an address, telephone number, and, if
available,
an electronic mail address at which the complaining party may be
contacted.

Office Phone: 978 640 3595
Email: ken@ecamm.com

5. A statement that the complaining party has a good faith belief that
use
of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the
copyright owner, it's agent, or the law.

The software being distributed on this server is not free, so
distributing it freely is not authorized.

6. A statement that the information in the notification is accurate, and
under penalty of perjury, that the complaining party is authorized to
act on
behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

As officer, I am authorized.

Thank you for your prompt response and cooperation.
Ken Aspeslagh
Ecamm Network, LLC


===8<===========End of original message text===========
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----
Version: GnuPG v1.2.5 (MingW32)

iD8DBQFBf+ZgvK/XpJs6oyURAiRJAKCEeW8a8+z2O82kxYqVK72bVlDdOQCdF/nL
0fw0v/umsDbbL+7up0NuUV8=
=Lbyt
-----END PGP SIGNATURE-----
